original: Lidman, Björn Viktor Eugén, prakt, läkare, Göteborg, f. 1/3/08 i Skellefteå av distr :lantmät. Harald L. o. Göthil- da Trägårdh. G. 41 m. gymn :dir. Eva Maria Mathsson. — Stud:ex. i Umeå 27, med. kand. i Sthlm 31 o. med. lic. där 36. Tf. und :läk. v. Beckomèerga sjukh. 35, tf. und :läk. o. assist :läk. v. Bodens las. kir. avd. samt tf. sjukstu-guläk. i Kiruna 36, assist :läk. v. Sahl-gr. sjukh. kir. avd. 36-37, tf. und:läk. där 37, tf. andre und :läk. v. Visby las. s. å., åter v. Sahlgr. sjukh. kir. avd. som tf. und:läk. 38, e. läk. där s. å., därjämte tf. prov:läk. i ohka distr. ■samt kort. förordn. v. las., e. läk. resp. tf. undiläk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. kir. avd. H 38-42, und:läk. å kvinnoklin. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. 43-47, tjg. som tf. över-läk. å Ekmanska sjukh. i Gbg sammani. sex mån. 42-44, egen prakt, i Gbg m. kvinnosjukd., förlossn. o. kir. som spec. sed. 47. Tjg. som läk. v. Sv. friv :kåren i Finl. under vinterkriget 39-40. FFrK4kl m sv.
translated: Lidman, Björn Viktor Eugén, (abbreviations: prakt = practitioner, läkare = doctor), Gothenburg, born on 1/3/08 in Skellefteå to parents Harald L. and Göthilda Trägårdh. Married in 1941 to gymnastics director Eva Maria Mathsson. Completed high school in Umeå in 1927, medical degree in Stockholm in 1931, and medical license there in 1936. Temporary assistant doctor at Beckomèerga Hospital in 1935, temporary assistant doctor and assistant surgeon at Boden Hospital surgical department, and temporary hospital physician in Kiruna in 1936. Assistant doctor at Sahlgr. Hospital surgical department from 1936 until 1937, temporary assistant doctor there in 1937, temporary second assistant doctor at Visby Hospital in the same year, back to Sahlgr. Hospital surgical department as temporary assistant doctor in 1938, a doctor there in the same year, as well as temporary district physician and short-term assignment at a hospital, a doctor, and temporary assistant doctor at Sahlgr. Hospital surgical department from 1938 until 1942. Female clinic assistant doctor at Sahlgr. Hospital from 1943 until 1947. Temporary chief physician at Ekmanska Hospital in Gothenburg for six months between 1942 and 1944. Established private practice in Gothenburg as a specialist in gynecology, obstetrics, and surgery since 1947. Served as a doctor in the Swedish Volunteer Corps in Finland during the Winter War (1939-1940). Awarded with the Fourteenth Class of the Order of the White Rose of Finland.

awards.name: Fourteenth Class of the Order of the White Rose of Finland
